title: Alasandala Charu 😋| Black eyed beans soup 🥣
content:
Side Dish: Alsandala Rasam  Servings: 5 Duration: 20 minutes  Rasam is a kind of savory indian soup we also call it ‘Charu’ It’s most appealing South Indian food as a side dish, goes well with rice 🍚 and Papad or fryums 😋 Rasam can make in different ways as I have shared three delicious Rasam recipes, they’re listed out here 👇 Tomato 🍅 Pepper Rasam/ Miriyala Charu Pappu charu 🍅| Tomato Lentils Soup 🥣  Raw Mango Rasam 😋| Mamidikaya Charu | Summer Special Checkout above links if you’re interested to know the recipe 🙂 I don’t know how many of you know this dish but if you could try this savory Indian soup, I’m sure you’ll definitely love 💗 it. Today, I prepared my favorite Rasam made with freshly homemade Rasam Powder or spice mix along with  cooked black eyed beans and tempering. I clearly remember my mom used to make it, I love to have it often and I have shared homemade Rasam Powder link in the below section 😍 Let’s start with Ingredients and Procedure Ingredients:
  • Black eyed beans/ Alasandalu -  60 gms (soaked & cooked )
  • Tomato 🍅- chopped
  • Coconut oil - 1/2 Tb sp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Garlic pods - 5 - chopped
  • Curry leaves - 8 - chopped
  • Kashmiri Dry Red chillies - 2
  • Hing/Asafoetida - 1/8 teaspoon
  • Turmeric Powder - 1/4 teaspoon
  • Rasam Powder  - 1/2 teaspoon
  • Jaggery - 2 pieces
  • Salt - 1 teaspoon
  • Coriander leaves - 3 tb sp
  • Water - 500 ml
Procedure:
  • Firstly, Soak black eyed beans for 8 hours, wash well and cook for 2 whistles with sufficient water and 1/4 teaspoon of salt
  • Add in oil, cumin seeds, curry leaves, garlic, Red chillies on medium heat vessel, sauté 30 seconds.
  • Then add chopped tomatoes, sauté 2 minutes
  • Next add Hing, turmeric powder, Salt, Jaggery, Rasam Powder and sauté a minute or so
  • After that, add cooked black eyed beans and water
  • Cook on medium heat , let it boil it takes around 5-7 minutes
  • Finally Add chopped coriander leaves, mix well and turn off heat
  • Serve hot with piping hot rice and Papad 😋
  • Happy Cooking 🥥 have a blissful day 🦋
